description:
I can’t remember. Who am I? What am I? Seville is a student at a magic academy who has no memories of anything from before he joined the school. Not understanding why he’s there, the time he spends at the academy feels hollow and empty. And since he doesn't know how to work hard, his grades are always the lowest in his year. Then, one day, the school headmaster, Albus, orders Seville to participate in a dangerous special training. "I want you to spread the use of magic in an area where they hold witch hunts." It has only been a few years since the war between the church and the witches came to an end—the world has not yet fully accepted witches and their magic. This is the dawn of the age of the witch. This is the story of how a young man, a boy who is no one special, and his companions, who all hold wounds in their hearts, set out and end up finding themselves.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: จอมเวทแห่งรุ่งอรุณ

tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/西田稔)

Took part as an art director on Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" in 2003.

**Alma Mater:** Liverpool Institute for Performing Arts (BA Music)

[Website](https://tatsumusic.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tatsu_saiki) | [SoundCloud](https://soundcloud.com/tatsuyan)

fripSide is a Japanese indie pop band. Started in 2002. They also have many other support members.  

On March 15, 2009, nao stated on the fripSide Official Website that she had graduated from fripSide. Sat and nao want to pursue different musical careers, as nao intends to pursue a solo singing career. Meanwhile Sat will continue in fripSide with a new project called, fripside: THE NEXT PROJECT. Seiyuu Yoshino Nanjo took over as the vocalist of fripSide with her debut single "only my railgun", the opening of the anime, To Aru Kagaku no Railgun. 

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Members__
- sat - [Satoshi Yaginuma](https://anilist.co/staff/111757) (八木沼悟志) - (lyrics, synthesizers, composer, arrangement) (2002-present)
- Mao Uesugi (上杉真央) - (vocals) (2022-present)
- Hisayo Abe (阿部寿世) - (vocals) (2022-present)

__Former Members__
- [nao](https://anilist.co/staff/118365/nao) (vocal, lyrics) (2002-2009)
- [Yoshino Nanjo](https://anilist.co/staff/96592/Yoshino-Nanjo) (南條愛乃) - (vocals, lyrics) (2009-2022)

An all female musical unit conformed by three NIJISANJI VTubers: Hakase Fuyuki, Furen E Lustario, and Takamiya Rion.
